intro: Impatiens lutzii, commonly known as the Lutz's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, round seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in its natural habitat.
